item.title: Pharmacy apologises after customers given wrong medicines, scripts in Broome
item.description: More than a dozen customers have come forward over concerns two Broome chemists have handed out the wrong medications.

item.title: Oscar Piastri defends McLaren and says he expects 'fair shot' at F1 title in 2026
item.description: Oscar Piastri insists the painful ending to his F1 title bid last season has only strengthened his resolve to be the "nice person" who brings the Formula 1 world drivers' crown back to Australia.

item.title: US-Russia nuclear weapons treaty expires as Trump rejects Moscow's one-year extension
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between Russia and the United States has expired after Donald Trump rejected an offer from his Russian counterpart.

item.title: Demersal fishing reforms drive fish and chip price rise on WA's south coast
item.description: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

item.title: Questions raised over $93 million investment in WA school with 30 per cent attendance rate
item.description: By the end of 2026 the WA government and Woodside will have spent over $93 million on Roebourne District High School and its 141 enrolled students. But last year only one in four upper school students attended.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.description: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

item.title: Terrorist act declaration for Invasion Day attempted bombing shows WA has changed
item.description: It will take time and significant effort to repair relationships with the Indigenous community amid the fallout from last week's attempted bombing in the Perth CBD — but other growing rifts in society will be even harder to mend.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to form into category two system in WA
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has a high chance of forming into a category two system, bringing destructive winds and heavy rain to northern WA.

item.title: Brodie Jake Dewar faces upgraded charge of manslaughter after Labor identity Tim Picton's death
item.description: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

item.title: WA author Craig Silvey has child exploitation bail conditions altered after complaining of media attention
item.description: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

item.title: Student allegedly raped by Hobart teacher in 1980s disclosed concerns, court told
item.description: A student who was allegedly raped by a Hobart teacher in the 1980s was told to focus on her studies after raising concerns with the teacher's behaviour, a court has heard.

item.title: AACTA 2026 winners list: Gory horror wins best film, Jacob Elordi drama dominates TV
item.description: Directors Danny and Michael Philippou clean up at the 2026 AACTA awards, taking home 10 statues for their chilling horror film Bring Her Back.

item.title: Indirect talks between US and Iran finish in Oman with indication they will continue
item.description: The two countries held talks mediated by Oman in Muscat after weeks of tensions between Washington and Tehran.

item.title: Former ambassador Ian Kemish writes about Europe's 'forgotten' war in debut novel Two Islands
item.description: Former ambassador Ian Kemish draws on his 25-year diplomatic career in his debut novel, Two Islands, set against the backdrop of the Balkan War.

item.title: Elders say truth-telling 'critical' to combatting racism after alleged terror attack
item.description: For Noongar Elders, the alleged attack on Boorloo/Perth is viewed against the background of a long history of violence. They are calling for a truth-telling commission to heal deep scars and help to combat racism.

item.description: As another T20 World Cup sneaks up on us, here's everything you need to know about the tournament, including a guide on how to pick which team to support, depending on your needs.

item.title: Did Ouyen break Victoria's heat record? A Bureau of Meteorology issue means the town may never know
item.description: It was tipped to be one of the hottest places on Earth last week, but we may never know exactly how hot it got in Ouyen — at least officially.

item.description: Almost every corner of Australia will pick up rain during the next seven days, including heavy falls and pockets of flooding in multiple states.

item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.description: Almost 300 people from Daly River have been evacuated to Darwin, with just a handful of residents staying behind.

item.description: While avoiding a direct hit, Karratha is still expected to feel the force of the category three cyclone as it tracks along the Pilbara coast tonight.

item.description: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

item.description: From rare cancers caught early to dementia foretold decades in advance, newborn genomic testing raises an unsettling question: Just because we can know, should we?

item.description: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

item.description: As the West reacts to the revelations in the latest batch of Epstein files, China has plans for the renminbi to become a global reserve currency.

item.description: India is briefly left reeling at 6-67 against an underdog United States team, but captain Suryakumar Yadav helps the hosts avoid a horror start at the T20 World Cup.

item.description: From grapes to red capsicum, here's how to prioritise some of this season's best fruit and veg.

item.title: How a Canberra-based refugee fled the Maduro regime along with millions of other Venezuelans
item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.description: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

item.description: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

item.description: As the New START treaty curbing the US and Russian nuclear weapons programs expires, the work we do here in the red centre has become more important than ever before.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn's horror crash at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games was always on the cards
item.description: Lindsey Vonn's shocking downhill crash at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games was always a possibility given the American was competing just nine days after rupturing her ACL. But it was never going to stop her from trying.

item.description: A $740 million program will expand support for veterans and include funding for social activities such as yoga and language classes, with new treatment including MDMA and psilocybin for the worst forms of PTSD also funded for the first time.

item.description: Local buyers are facing stiff competition from outside investors, with regional house price rises tipped to continue.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

item.description: Cricket umpire numbers increase significantly in Victoria, but some regions remain in desperate need.

item.title: Australian T20 World Cup squad looks different but do not count it out, Mitch Marsh says
item.description: Despite a slew of key injuries leaving the Australian team unrecognisable, captain Mitch Marsh is confident about the experience left in the side.

item.title: Limestone Coast hospital's staff shortage in spotlight after former administrator's fall
item.description: David Walshaw spent 20 years looking after the Limestone Coast's hospitals, but a fall made him realise the system was failing patients.

item.title: ASX 200 rallies as CBA surges, Aussie dollar above 71 US cents — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market has finished strongly after the first "big day" of reporting season with good earnings news for the Commonwealth Bank for the first half of the financial year. Look back on our live blog.

item.title: Images of alleged tobacco wars kingpin Kazem Hamad released in Iraq
item.description: Hamad was deported from Australia in 2023 and has been a key person of interest relating to firebombings at Victorian tobacco shops and businesses.

item.title: US immigration bosses questioned over Donald Trump's ICE crackdown
item.description: Democrats level a litany of complaints against the heads of America's immigration agencies during a rare hearing in Washington.

item.title: Trump told police chief 'everyone' knew about Epstein, FBI document says
item.description: Donald Trump allegedly told police in 2006 that people in New York knew about Epstein, a newly uncovered FBI interview shows.

item.title: Five-year-old girl killed in ATV rollover on Queensland's Western Downs
item.description: A young girl has died and a boy has been injured after an ATV being driven by a child rolled rolled on a rural property near Chinchilla on Tuesday evening.

item.title: Volunteers say neglect by state's wildlife department caused bushfires on WA's south coast
item.description: Farmers and volunteer firefighters say decades of neglect by WA's Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions is at the heart of fires that ripped through more than 200,000 hectares of state-managed land.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Stunning cheating admission overshadows medal win as Naumov brings tears with tribute — quick hits from day four
item.description: A Norwegian's first-ever medal is overshadowed by a stunning admission to reporters as Maxim Naumov pays tribute to his parents in the most beautiful way. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Western quoll joey born in outback NSW likely to be first in a century
item.description: Once thought to be extinct in NSW, the small, spotted, and highly photogenic western quoll is making a hard-fought comeback to the wild.

item.title: Fateful wrong turn, quiet cancer battle possible factors in missing prospector's suspected death
item.description: An inquest into Barry Podmore's disappearance in WA's remote Wheatbelt hears the 73-year-old was waging a private battle with cancer and may have become lost in bushland.

item.title: What 30 years on the domestic violence front line taught police negotiator Vincent Hurley
item.description: Years on the front line of domestic violence surfaced in a frustration-filled moment on national television for Vincent Hurley. He explains what motivates him to keep fighting for change.

item.title: Hand-built high country bridges lost to fires, taking decades of history with them
item.description: Volunteers are weighing the future of the High Country Rail Trail after the loss of 12 historic trestle bridges — and decades of work — to bushfires.

item.title: Race against bulldozers to save ancient grass trees in WA's South West
item.description: Some of WA's oldest grass trees are being rescued from land clearing and development amid a population and property boom, preserving a unique part of the South West's natural heritage.

item.title: Queensland records first outbreak of Mimosa pigra — giant sensitive tree — in 25 years
item.description: A giant sensitive tree infestation has been detected near a lake near Brisbane and authorities say they have "no idea" how it got there.

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons-inspired game breaks down social barriers for neurodivergent kids
item.description: An Adelaide clinical psychologist creates a simplified version of Dungeons and Dragons to help neurodivergent children and young people learn social skills and develop peer connections.

item.title: Socceroos striker Mo Toure scores hat-trick on starting debut in English Championship for Norwich
item.description: Mohamed Toure moved to England recently on a $5 million deal and it is already looking like a great decision for the 21-year-old forward.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank shares rise after CBA reports increased profits as it lifts home lending volumes
item.description: CBA's net profit for the first half of the financial year rose 5 per cent to $5.367 billion, beating analyst expectations, on the back of increased lending and deposit volumes.

item.title: Milano Cortina 2026 is the most gender-equal Winter Olympics ever, aside from Nordic Combined
item.description: Nordic Combined is the only sport at any Olympic Games — summer and winter — that does not have an event for women. It's an omission that is putting the entire future of the sport at risk.

item.title: Outgoing Queensland Police Commissioner Steve Gollschewki confident service 'heading in right direction'
item.description: Police Commissioner Steve Gollschewski has announced his retirement to focus on his family and health after a 46-year career with the service.

item.title: Perth Festival opens with outdoor music, light sculptures and stories shared via old red telephone
item.description: Australia's longest running arts event, the Perth Festival, began on the weekend with Humans of New York-style videos in which locals tell their stories using an old red telephone on a bridge.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 5, Wednesday, February 11
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: DPP apologises after office 'dropped the ball' over police officer assault case
item.description: A court decision in which a woman who assaulted a South Australian police officer with a glass bottle was spared jail prompts an extraordinary concession from the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP).

item.title: Formula 1 2026: New engines and no DRS headline major changes in grand prix
item.description: New engines, new regulations and an 11-team grid are just some of the changes in Formula 1 this season. Get up to speed with what is new in F1 ahead of the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Doongmabulla Springs decision leaves Qld government to weigh appeal or face trial
item.description: Wangan and Jagalingou peoples await the state government's next move after a win in their fight to have alleged damage to a sacred site near a mine in Central Queensland investigated.

item.title: No body-worn video evidence available for inquest into Krista Kach's death, coroner hears
item.description: A court hears a NSW inquest will need to rely on eyewitness accounts of the 2023 death of Krista Kach, who was shot with a beanbag round following a 10-hour stand-off with police in 2023.

item.title: Cryptosporidium cluster at Waterworld leads to closure of Adelaide Aquatic Centre pools
item.description: SA Health is urging people with gastroenteritis symptoms not to visit public swimming pools after eight cases at one swimming centre, including one child who was hospitalised and another who also visited the Adelaide Aquatic Centre.

item.title: Axed literary magazine Meanjin is resurrected by Queensland University of Technology
item.description: The 85-year-old literary journal Meanjin will return to Brisbane, where it was first published, after it was controversially closed by Melbourne University Press last year.

item.title: Telstra to axe up to 650 roles in mass redundancy round, some jobs to be outsourced to India
item.description: Telstra notifies staff of plans to outsource hundreds of jobs to an India-based technology company.

item.title: Former Carlton legend Peter Dean hospitalised after serious assault in Albury
item.description: Former AFL player Peter Dean is recovering in hospital after he sustained serious head and facial injuries in an alleged assault at Albury on the New South Wales Victorian border.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell brings damage and rain to farmers in WA's south
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says a weather system influenced by ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell delivered storms to the Great Southern and central Wheatbelt this week.

item.title: US politician Ro Khanna reveals names of six 'powerful men' scrubbed from Epstein files
item.description: US politician Ro Khanna has publicly named six men whose identities were scrubbed from the Epstein files, including the former boss of Victoria's Secret, who the FBI suspected was a co-conspirator of the sex offender's crimes.

item.title: Adelaide's own a medal contender for US in women's double luge at Winter Olympics
item.description: The driest state in the driest country of the world might seem the unlikeliest of places for a star in the Winter Olympics sport of luge to emerge, but Chevonne Forgan will be a medal contender tonight — albeit for Team USA.

item.title: Supersized fatberg clogging Sydney sewer blamed for mysterious debris balls on beach
item.description: The debris balls that have washed up on NSW beaches in recent years are likely to continue as Sydney Water admits a massive fatberg it cannot reach is clogging sewers.

item.title: New video sheds light on beginning of altercation between police officers and Town Hall protester
item.description: A new video filmed by a bystander and shared with ABC NEWS Verify shows the full minute before two police officers began punching a protester, shedding light on the beginning of the altercation.

item.title: Israeli President Isaac Herzog welcomes 'new beginning' in meeting with Anthony Albanese
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog meets with the prime minister at Parliament House in Canberra, saying his visit to Australia has been "very emotional".

item.title: Hundreds treated for e-bike injuries in 2025 at Sydney St Vincent Hospital
item.description: More than 200 people were treated for e-bike related injuries at a single Sydney hospital last year, with one medical professor describing the trend as an "epidemic".

item.title: RBA deputy governor defends central bank from critics, wonders if Australia is more inflation-prone
item.description: RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser says central banks should not criticise normal government spending choices, but he wonders if Australia's economy is more inflation-prone because it is so finely balanced.

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.title: Labor tries again on super taxes, but yet to secure Greens support
item.description: A second attempt to raise taxes on high super balances has been presented to parliament, but will require the support of the Greens to secure Senate passage.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's Triple Zero call to save family swept out to sea at Geographe Bay released
item.description: Police release the recording of the Triple Zero call made by 13-year-old Austin Appelbee after his marathon 4 kilometre swim through rough seas to save his family.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: Channel Nine says Warren Tredrea has now paid costs over long-running legal battle
item.description: Channel Nine has confirmed it has received legal costs from former AFL player and sports presenter Warren Tredrea, who was ordered to pay $149,000 to his ex-employer.

item.title: Jakara Anthony may not have won Winter Olympics moguls gold, but winning is not always measured in medals
item.description: Disaster stared Jakara Anthony in the face and meted out the cruellest of injustices as she missed out on a moguls medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games. But her response showed us the character that should make Australia proud regardless.

item.title: The identities linked to corruption at the CFMEU, according to Queensland's Commission of Inquiry
item.description: Members of bikie gangs, convicted murderers and violent criminals are among more than 25 people who allegedly benefited from or are linked to corrupt behaviour at the CFMEU, according to a report.

item.title: Crack found in new $786m Bridgewater Bridge, RTI documents reveal
item.description: Days before the official opening, the Tasmanian government's largest-ever infrastructure project hit a hurdle, with a large crack picked up in one of the Bridgewater Bridge's piers detected and fixed, documents show.

item.title: Angus Taylor is moving to challenge Sussan Ley — but not on his terms
item.description: Angus Taylor was holidaying in Europe when his colleagues began manoeuvring to topple Sussan Ley. A leadership spill this week wasn't what he or Sussan Ley wanted.

item.title: The Antarctic landscape around Wilkes.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat Jamaica 80-33 in third netball Test to claim 3-0 series win
item.description: Coach Stacey Marinkovich believes a refreshed Diamonds squad has found its "identity" ahead of attempting to become the first Australian netball team to defend Commonwealth Games gold.

item.title: A look at the ballistic missile program Iran refuses to negotiate on
item.description: Iran has spent decades building the largest and most diverse ballistic missile stockpile in the Middle East and is refusing US demands to put limits on the weapons program.

item.title: A man was reported to the RSPCA after the alleged abuse of a puppy.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Animal abuse charge takes one year as RSPCA prosecutions in Queensland drastically decline
item.description: A man has been charged with animal cruelty a year after neighbours first made a complaint to the RSPCA.

item.title: The cast of the Artful Dodger on why we keep coming back to classics like Oliver Twist
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: James Van Der Beek, star of Dawson's Creek, dies aged 48 after colorectal cancer diagnosis
item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.title: Heatwave temperatures to peak in south-east Queensland, rain on the way
item.description: A locally intense heatwave will peak across south-east Queensland today, with incoming rain set to drop temperatures over the weekend.

item.title: Live: Taylor confirms he'll challenge Ley for Liberal leadership
item.description: Angus Taylor has confirmed in a social media video he will challenge Sussan Ley for the Liberal leadership. Follow live.

item.title: Baz Luhrmann: 'AI doesn't have a soul'
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Women reveal alleged assaults near Daylesford after solo hiker raises alarm
item.description: A woman's solo hike through regional Victoria took a disturbing turn near Daylesford, raising questions about safety and police responses.

item.title: Students escorted out after mass shooting in a school in Canada
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Darwin traditional owners feel 'bulldozed' by ambitious solar farm company's approach to consultation
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin is seeking a court ruling that no native title claim exists at the proposed site.

item.title: How Perth paedophile Jason William Forbes hid in plain sight in suburban Baldivis
item.description: "A regular sort of bloke," is how one of Jason Forbes's neighbours described the 39-year-old electrician — but inside the walls of his unassuming Baldivis home, he was hiding a dark secret.

item.title: Pam Bondi clashes with members of Congress in Epstein files hearing
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Dispute over West Bank football pitch sparks international campaign
item.description: A campaign to save a West Bank football pitch from demolition has gone global. The sport's most powerful bodies — as well as social media influencers — have intervened to pressure Israeli authorities to reconsider its destruction.

item.title: Antisemitism in Australia 'frightening' says Israeli President Isaac Herzog ahead of Melbourne visit
item.description: Police are expecting thousands of people to gather in Melbourne's CBD again on Thursday to protest against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit.
